page.title: 12 Holywell Row Chapel
page.content: Originally the Chapel was a Quaker Meeting House,built in approximately 1678 like a barn,with a thatched roof, and one large room downstairs and two rooms upstairs. In 1759 a six foot wall was built round the graveyard to keep the cattle out. By 1875 the Methodists were holding services in the Meeting House and regular Sunday Schools were conducted. In 1897 the Meeting House was purchased by the Wesleyan Methodist Church and became their own Chapel. In 1955 a new extension was erected. There are a number of rare organs in the Chapel,one of which was built in Bury St.Edmunds. Most of the furniture is made by hand in memory of certain members of the Chapel. There is an old picture of Quakers End in the Chapel for safe keeping.
